SizeThe size of a bounded object or region, mostly conceptualized in terms of the amount of space it occupies. Particular sizes are generally defined in relation to some norm, and can be represented as positions on a 'size scale'.Sizebig.a

State-related frames

Number of s: 8

FrameDescriptionFN FrameLUs
Caused change of stateCause_change
Change of stateChange_of_state_endstate, Change_of_state_initial_state
ExistencestasisExistencebe
exist
is
existence
Experiencing a negative state
Experiencing a stateState
Improving a state
Self-initiated state changeExperiencer of state acts so as to change that state.
StateThis frame represents the association/relation between an entity (state_holder) and a property/state (state_type). Specific entities will differ as to which set of properties/states they can or are likely to be associated with. The current frame does not include a temporal component, and thus cannot be directly used to indicate the duration of a given state, or the change of states over time; these are handled by 'subcases' of this frame, such as Change of state and Experiencing a state, which do include temporal structure. In at least some cases, the properties may also be represented as separate, individual frames (e.g. Temperature, Size) which elaborate the internal structure and set of potential values of that property.State
